intro: Eriospermum flabellatum, commonly known as the desert flabellum, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, often in clusters at the ends of its stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Eriospermum flabellatum is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
